definition: to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to walk (side part of split character)
to press on towards/to close in on/to approach/to draw near
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to force a draw (in chess, competition etc)
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
to press for payment of debts/to dun

sentences.english: Suarez and Andy Carroll could be a real handful together next season.
sentences.chinese: 小苏和安迪下赛季的搭档一定会很牛逼的。

sentences.english: The unidentified armed group used guns to force the Chinese crew to increase speed sailing towards Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 不明武装用枪逼着中国船员加足马力向泰国驶去。

sentences.english: I think the cup of 34E is absolutely niubable, you should be proud of.
sentences.chinese: 我认为34E罩杯是很值得牛逼的，你应该感到骄傲。

sentences.english: Who is to fight Wickham, and make him marry her, if he comes away?
sentences.chinese: 他一走，还有谁去跟韦翰决斗，逼着他跟丽迪雅结婚？

sentences.english: OK, so don't make me do anything that I'll regret.
sentences.chinese: 那么别逼我做令我后悔的事。

sentences.english: The paper puts emphasis on the corners mechanism in puer tea market.
sentences.chinese: 文章重点对普洱茶市中的逼仓机理进行了分析。

sentences.english: "This is tearing people apart, " said Minnewaukan Mayor Trish McQuoid, fighting back tears.
sentences.chinese: 密尼沃坎镇长麦阔伊德含泪说，这把人们都逼疯了。

sentences.english: His friends pressed him for the truth about his relationship with Yvonne.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友逼他老实说出跟伊芳的关系。

sentences.english: And don't get me started on that Liberal anti-British design for the costumes.
sentences.chinese: 别逼我开始自由的反英服装设计。
马丁逼刘易斯逼得很紧。

sentences.english: His father forced him to a clean shave.
sentences.chinese: 他被父亲逼着剃光了胡子。

sentences.english: Liverpool are reported to be lining up a move for highly-rated Rennes winger Sylvain Marveaux.
sentences.chinese: 据报道，利物浦看上了法甲雷恩队的牛逼飞翼马尔沃。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, they will wring the truth out of the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 我们迟早是会从囚犯口里逼出真情的。

sentences.english: The road of life is forced to come out.
sentences.chinese: 人生之路是逼着走出来的。

sentences.english: She said she was told to sleep with her husband, but refused.
sentences.chinese: 她说她被逼和丈夫上床，但她拒绝了。

sentences.english: Good thing he had Andrew Bynum and a couple of keyed-up reserve guards as teammates.
sentences.chinese: 还好他有安猪以及一帮牛逼哄哄的后卫这些队友。

definition: variant of 裝屄|装屄[zhuang1 bi1]
to force a draw (in chess, competition etc)
grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
